chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Same conditions as probation.
Consecutive to: case number 12CF94.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on January 12, 2015.
12/12/17 AMENDED:  COURT ORDERS PROBATION BE EXTENDED FOR 1 YEAR.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Must make minimum monthly payments in the sum of $100.00 beginning on 02/01/2015.
12/12/17 AMENDED:  COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT MUST PAY $50.00 PER MONTH.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Must comply with recommended follow-up treatment from the AODA assessment.

Defendant Anthony S Lowe in court with Agent Kim Gunderson.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
$2180 owing.  Payment history given to the parties in court.  Defendant does not want his probation extended.  Court finds Anthony has not made a good faith effort.  Defendant relates why payments on restitution are not being paid.  Must pay $50 per month.  Probation is extended for 1 year.
